## auth.TenantManager interface

Defines the tenant manager used to help manage tenant related operations. This includes: <ul> <li>The ability to create, update, list, get and delete tenants for the underlying project.</li> <li>Getting a `TenantAwareAuth` instance for running Auth related operations (user management, provider configuration management, token verification, email link generation, etc) in the context of a specified tenant.</li> </ul>

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
interface TenantManager 
```

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [authForTenant(tenantId)](./firebase-admin.auth.tenantmanager.authfortenant.md) |  |
|  [createTenant(tenantOptions)](./firebase-admin.auth.tenantmanager.createtenant.md) | Creates a new tenant. When creating new tenants, tenants that use separate billing and quota will require their own project and must be defined as <code>full_service</code>. |
|  [deleteTenant(tenantId)](./firebase-admin.auth.tenantmanager.deletetenant.md) | Deletes an existing tenant. |
|  [getTenant(tenantId)](./firebase-admin.auth.tenantmanager.gettenant.md) | Gets the tenant configuration for the tenant corresponding to a given <code>tenantId</code>. |
|  [listTenants(maxResults, pageToken)](./firebase-admin.auth.tenantmanager.listtenants.md) | Retrieves a list of tenants (single batch only) with a size of <code>maxResults</code> starting from the offset as specified by <code>pageToken</code>. This is used to retrieve all the tenants of a specified project in batches. |
|  [updateTenant(tenantId, tenantOptions)](./firebase-admin.auth.tenantmanager.updatetenant.md) | Updates an existing tenant configuration. |
